title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 153.6 - Signing of New York State income tax returns and claims for refunds prepared by a person other than the taxpayer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 153.6 - Signing of New York State income tax returns and claims for refunds prepared by a person other than the taxpayer

State Regulations

Tax Law, §§ 653, 658(g)

An individual who is an income tax return preparer (see
section
158.12
[d][1]
of this Title), with respect to a New York State income tax return or a claim
for refund, must sign such return or such claim for refund in accordance with
the provisions of section
158.12
of this Title and forms, instructions, or other appropriate guidance of the

Department of Taxation and Finance. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§
153.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
